snippet: Mr. Flanagan, the new majority leader of the New York State Senate, made more money in part-time work on Long Island than he did as a legislator.
abstract: New York State Sen John J Flanagan, new majority leader, has claimed to not know whether clients of firm Forchelli, Curto, Deegan, Schwartz, Mineo & Terrana, where he has worked part-time, have done business with state; firm has large list of clients who have been directly affected by state agencies, underscoring concerns on part of watchdogs about lawmakers working as private-sector lawyers to supplement income.

byline.original: By THOMAS KAPLAN and SUSANNE CRAIG

lead_paragraph: Mr. Flanagan, the new majority leader of the New York State Senate, made more money in part-time work on Long Island than he did as a legislator.

headline.main: John J. Flanagan’s Former Law Firm Had Matters Before State Agencies
headline.print_headline: New Senate Leader’s Former Law Firm Had Matters Before State Agencies

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Forchelli, Curto, Deegan, Schwartz, Mineo & Terrana LLP
